label: Policy LCD_39543
description: Policy rules for LCD_39543

label: eligibility_refractory_to_c...
description: Patient must be refractory to conventional therapy (documented behavioral, pharmacologic, and/or surgical corrective therapy) for urinary incontinence.

label: eligibility_appropriate_sur...
description: Patient must be an appropriate surgical candidate such that implantation with anesthesia can occur.

label: eligibility_patient_ability...
description: Patient must be able to demonstrate adequate ability to record voiding diary data for proper evaluation of implant procedure results.

label: eligibility_refractory_to_c...
description: For FI coverage, documented failure or intolerance to conventional therapy (e.g., dietary modification, bulking and pharmacologic treatment) is required.

label: eligibility_test_stimulatio...
description: Patient must demonstrate 50% or greater improvement through test stimulation to support subsequent permanent implantation for urinary incontinence.

label: eligibility_fecal_incontine...
description: For FI coverage, patient must have greater than 2 incontinent episodes on average per week.

label: eligibility_fecal_incontine...
description: For FI coverage, duration of incontinence must be greater than 6 months.

label: eligibility_fecal_incontine...
description: For FI coverage, duration of incontinence must be greater than 12 months after vaginal childbirth.

label: eligibility_percutaneous_te...
description: For FI coverage, a successful percutaneous test stimulation is defined as at least 50% sustained improvement in symptoms.

label: eligibility_percutaneous_te...
description: For FI coverage, sustained improvement from percutaneous test stimulation must last more than 48 hours.

label: exclusion_stress_incontinen...
description: Patients with stress incontinence are excluded from SNS coverage.

label: exclusion_urinary_obstructi...
description: Patients with urinary obstruction are excluded from SNS coverage.

label: exclusion_neurologic_diseas...
description: Patients with specific neurologic diseases (e.g., diabetes with peripheral nerve involvement, multiple sclerosis, spinal cord injury) associated with secondary manifestations of urinary incontinence indications are excluded from SNS coverage.

label: exclusion_anorectal_malform...
description: FI coverage excludes conditions related to anorectal malformation (e.g., congenital malformation, defects of the external anal sphincter over 60 degrees, visible sequelae of pelvic radiation, active anal abscesses and fistulae).

label: exclusion_chronic_inflammat...
description: FI coverage excludes conditions related to chronic inflammatory bowel disease.

label: exclusion_neurologic_condit...
description: FI coverage excludes incontinence related to another neurologic condition such as peripheral neuropathy or complete spinal cord injury.

label: non_covered_condition_chron...
description: Sacral Nerve Stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic constipation.

label: non_covered_condition_chron...
description: Sacral Nerve Stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic pelvic pain (CPP).

label: documentation_required_hist...
description: A complete history and physical examination must be documented in the patient's medical record.

label: documentation_required_void...
description: Voiding diaries must be documented in the patient's medical record.

label: documentation_required_urod...
description: Urodynamic studies for urinary incontinence must be documented in the patient's medical record.
